page.title: 18Butterton lorry-driver's day
page.content: My dad is a long distance lorry driver. He gets up sometimes as early as 4.30a.m. but rarely after 9a.m. For breakfast he usually has sandwiches and a cup of tea. He drives an articulated lorry transporting massive stone pipes from our house to places like Manchester, Newmarket, London, Mull and even up to Scotland. At dinner-time he usually buys a paper and something to drink to go with his sandwiches. When he gets to his destination he has a word with the workers who unload the lorry with cranes, diggers, etc. He takes his load anywhere, to housing estates, farms, children's homes, racing studs and many other places. When the lorry has been unloaded he comes home for his tea. He then waters the hanging basket before watching television.
